<h1><b>Kate Miller</b></h1><br>
<p style="font-size:16px;"><a href="./info/Kate_Miller_CV_2025.pdf">Curriculum vitae</a></p>
<h2>Summary</h2>
<p style="font-size:16px;">
Senior Quantitative Ecologist (GS-13) with 20+ years of experience directing ecological monitoring, landscape restoration, and data science modernization across U.S. National parks. Proven leader in developing automated analytics and decision-support tools that inform park planning, conservation policy, and climate resilience efforts across eastern parks. Recognized with multiple national awards for technical innovation, ground-breaking research, and measurable outcomes.
<ul style="font-size:16px">
<li>Founding member of the <a href="https://www.nps.gov/im/resilient-forests-initiative.htm">National Park Service Resilient Forest Initiative</a> to increase forest resilience in eastern national parks through landscape-level restoration, information sharing, and innovative science.</li> 
<li>Thorough knowledge of and experience sampling forest and wetland ecosystems in the Eastern US.</li>
<li>Extensive experience designing and implementing long-term monitoring programs, developing ecological indicators, and integrating with management.</li>
<li>Advanced statistical skills, including sample design, generalized linear mixed modelling, multivariate statistics, spatial and conditional autoregressive modelling, and machine learning. </li>
<li>Advanced data science skills, including functional programming and iteration, package development, version control and GitHub, automated reporting, data wrangling and manipulation, and data visualization. Fluent in R and HTML/CSS, and experience with SQL, LaTex, and Python.</li>
<li>Extensive experience analyzing complex datasets, including the National Land Cover Database, gridded climate and weather station data, US Forest Service Forest Inventory and Analysis data, and Environmental Protection Agency National Aquatic Resource Survey data. 
Extensive experience working on and leading interdisciplinary teams for planning, monitoring, and implementation of management actions in national parks.</li>
<li>Adept with GIS and GPS technologies, relational databases, spreadsheets, and word processing.</li></ul></p>

<h2>Github code repositories</h2>
<ul style="font-size:16px">
<li>Github profile: <a href="https://github.com/KateMMiller">KateMMiller</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/KateMMiller/forestMIDN">forestMIDN:</a> R package for summarizing and compiling MIDN forest data</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/KateMMiller/forestNETN">forestNETN:</a> R package for summarizing and compiling NETN forest data</li>

<li><a href="https://github.com/KateMMiller/forestTrends">forestTrends:</a> R package for using non-parametric bootstrap to assess temporal linear trends with fixed plot data and for non-parametric power simulations of linear trends.</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/KateMMiller/climateNETN">climateNETN:</a> R package for downloading, summarizing and visualizing monthly climate data for NETN parks by park centroid. See <a href="https://katemmiller.github.io/climateNETN/">NETN climate summaries:</a> for the latest summaries in NETN parks based on NOAA monthly gridded climate data. </li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/KateMMiller/wetlandACAD">wetlandACAD:</a> R package for summarizing and compiling freshwater wetland data in Acadia National Park</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/KateMMiller/wetlandViz">wetlandViz:</a> R shiny app to visualize freshwater wetland data in Acadia National Park. Contact me for a link to the visualizer.</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/katemmiller/wetlandhtln">wetlandHTLN:</a> R package for summarizing and compiling freshwater wetland data in Heartland Network, including automating calculation of the Ohio EPA Vegetation Index of Biotic Integrity. See the <a href="https://katemmiller.github.io/wetlandHTLN/">How-To website</a> for tips on installing and using this package.</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/KateMMiller/waterNETN">waterNETN:</a> R package for importing, querying, summarizing, and visualizing NETN water monitoring data. See the <a href="https://katemmiller.github.io/waterNETN/">How-To website</a> for tips on installing and using this package.</li>
</ul>
